assignment5

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment5.Shape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cone, Cylinder, Parallelepiped, Sphere

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    Shape is an abstract class that has a Point3D variable that correspond to the center point in a 3 dimensional shape. It also has accessor methods for returning the distance from origin (0,0,0) to the center, the surface area, and the volume. The getVolume() and getSurfaceArea() methods are abstract and must be overridden.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shape(int a, int b, int c)
      Shape() is a constructor method that receives 3 integers that correspond to a single point in a 3 dimensional space.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
      compareTo() is a method used to compare the volume of two Shape objects.
      double getDistance()
      getDistance() is an accessor method that computes the distance from origin (0,0,0) to the center of the shape (information stored in the object Point3D) It requests the information from the Point3D object and then uses the distance formula √((x2−x1)^2+(y2−y1)^2+(z2−z1)^2) with x1, y1 and z1 ==0 and returns the result.
      abstract double getSurfaceArea()
      getSurfaceArea() is an abstract method that must be overridden.
      abstract double getVolume()
      getVolume() is an abstract method that must be overridden.
      java.lang.String toString()
      toString() method requests a formatted string from a Point3D object that corresponds to the center of a 3 dimensional Shape.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shape

        public Shape(int a,
             int b,
             int c)
        Shape() is a constructor method that receives 3 integers that correspond to a single point in a 3 dimensional space. It then uses the 3 integers to create a Point3D.
        Parameters:
        a - used to create a Point3D
        b - used to create a Point3D
        c - used to create a Point3D

    • Method Detail

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance()
        getDistance() is an accessor method that computes the distance from origin (0,0,0) to the center of the shape (information stored in the object Point3D) It requests the information from the Point3D object and then uses the distance formula √((x2−x1)^2+(y2−y1)^2+(z2−z1)^2) with x1, y1 and z1 ==0 and returns the result.
        Returns:
        returns the distance from (0,0,0) the point held in Point3D.

      • getSurfaceArea

        public abstract double getSurfaceArea()
        getSurfaceArea() is an abstract method that must be overridden. It is to be used to compute the surface area of a 3 dimensional shape.
        Returns:
        return the surface area of a 3 dimensional shape as a double.

      • getVolume

        public abstract double getVolume()
        getVolume() is an abstract method that must be overridden. It is to be used to compute the volume of a 3 dimensional shape.
        Returns:
        return the volume of a 3 dimensional shape as a double.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        compareTo() is a method used to compare the volume of two Shape objects. If the volume of the shape being compared to is less it returns a -1, if it is more it returns a 1 and it returns a 0 if the volume is equal.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Parameters:
        o - is a Shape object to compare against.
        Returns:
        -1 ,1 or 0 to signify if the volume is less, more or equal.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString() method requests a formatted string from a Point3D object that corresponds to the center of a 3 dimensional Shape. It then returns that string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns a formatted string received from a Point3D object.
